divs: Sighting DetailsMy wife, a friend, and myself were sitting on our back porch enjoying the evening air and sky when my wife gasped and asked, "what's that?" as she pointed towards a white sphere to the north of us. It travelled in a linear path south to north, but seemed much larger than a normal satellite crossing the night sky. It flared out like a light bulb when its given way too much juice, stayed brilliant and the size of a dime held in my hand at arms length, then went back to its original brightness of about the size of a popcorn kernel at arms length then in a few seconds simply disappeared. The next evening I was outside on my back porch about the same time and noticed the exact same object to the north but flying in a curved fashion start out as a kernel of light, to the dime sized light, then to the kernel again and vanish. I felt as if I was watching something unusual and debated whether or not to tell about the sighting.
